Projected deaths from COVID-19 models

Source: R/cdc_aggregated_projections.R
cdc_aggregated_projections.Rd

The US CDC gathers projections from several groups around the world and aggregates them into a single data resource. See the reference below for details of the models.

cdc_aggregated_projections()

Details

These models are not updated daily but more like weekly. This function will attempt to grab the latest version.

References

  • https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/covid-data/forecasting-us.html

See also

Other data-import: apple_mobility_data(), beoutbreakprepared_data(), covidtracker_data(), descartes_mobility_data(), ecdc_data(), eu_data_cache_data(), google_mobility_data(), healthdata_projections_data(), jhu_data(), jhu_us_data(), kff_icu_beds(), nytimes_county_data(), us_county_geo_details(), us_healthcare_capacity(), us_state_distancing_policy(), usa_facts_data()

Examples

res = cdc_aggregated_projections()
head(res)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 8
#>   model forecast_date target target_week_end… location_name point quantile_0.025
#>   <chr> <date>        <chr>  <date>           <chr>         <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1 Univ… 2020-04-20    1 wk … 2020-04-25       US            49766             NA
#> 2 CU 4… 2020-04-20    1 wk … 2020-04-25       Alabama         184            157
#> 3 CU 4… 2020-04-20    1 wk … 2020-04-25       Alaska           15             15
#> 4 CU 4… 2020-04-20    1 wk … 2020-04-25       Arizona         265            222
#> 5 CU 4… 2020-04-20    1 wk … 2020-04-25       Arkansas         50             42
#> 6 CU 4… 2020-04-20    1 wk … 2020-04-25       California     2012           1792
#> # … with 1 more variable: quantile_0.975 <dbl>
dplyr::glimpse(res)
#> Rows: 1,645
#> Columns: 8
#> $ model                <chr> "University of Geneva", "CU 40% contact reductio…
#> $ forecast_date        <date> 2020-04-20, 2020-04-20, 2020-04-20, 2020-04-20,…
#> $ target               <chr> "1 wk ahead cum death", "1 wk ahead cum death", …
#> $ target_week_end_date <date> 2020-04-25, 2020-04-25, 2020-04-25, 2020-04-25,…
#> $ location_name        <chr> "US", "Alabama", "Alaska", "Arizona", "Arkansas"…
#> $ point                <dbl> 49766, 184, 15, 265, 50, 2012, 585, 2153, 232, 1…
#> $ quantile_0.025       <dbl> NA, 157, 15, 222, 42, 1792, 525, 1748, 175, 1162…
#> $ quantile_0.975       <dbl> NA, 226, 18, 325, 62, 2520, 650, 2483, 306, 1715…

# available models
table(res$model)
#> 
#> CU 20% contact reduction CU 30% contact reduction CU 40% contact reduction 
#>                      204                      204                      204 
#>                     IHME                     LANL                     MOBS 
#>                      208                      212                      180 
#>     University of Geneva                UT Austin                      YYG 
#>                        1                      208                      224 

# projection targets
table(res$target)
#> 
#> 1 wk ahead cum death 2 wk ahead cum death 3 wk ahead cum death 
#>                  412                  411                  411 
#> 4 wk ahead cum death 
#>                  411 

min(res$forecast_date)
#> [1] "2020-04-20"
max(res$target_week_end_date)
#> [1] "2020-05-16"
